name: Bees: A Story of Survival
description:
Bringing some buzz into your summer.

Journey into the world of bees in a stunning new immersive experience that brings together the beauty of art with the power of science. Created by the National Museums Liverpool in partnership with award-winning artist and sculptor, Wolfgang Buttress, the exhibition highlights 120-million years of bee adaptation and survival, telling the epic tale of these incredible creatures and their relationship to us and the natural world.

Based on science and full of imagination, the experiential exhibition presents a fusion of nature, art, music, and architecture that transports visitors into the world of bees - from the tiny, fascinating anatomy of a single bee and the magical wonder of honey bee colonies to the important roles bees play in our lives and the everyday threats they face.

Through immersive environments, art installations, soundscapes, and more, learn about the life of bees and the world they inhabit.

name: Yacht Rock Show Celebration
description:
The Yacht Rock Show Canada is an authentic tribute to the 70s and 80s Classic Smooth Rock Era that defined a generation.

 Experience an unforgettable musical voyage, dancing and listening to classic hits from artists including: Toto, Styx, The Doobie Brothers, Michael McDonald, Christopher Cross, Kenny Loggins, Steely Dan, Boz Scaggs, Player, Little River Band, Ambrosia.

The El Mocambo is a legendary live music and entertainment venue in Toronto, Canada, that has hosted countless world-famous artists since it opened in 1948, including The Rolling Stones, Elvis Costello, Blondie, The Ramones, and Stevie Ray Vaughan. The new El Mocambo features state-of-the-art sound and lighting, a recording studio, and multiple floors for events and performances, offering a modern, VIP live music experience while maintaining its historical significance.
